meanings.definition: The quality or state of being untidy or dirty.
meanings.sent1: Her room showed signs of slovenliness with clothes strewn all over the floor.
meanings.sent2: The slovenliness of the kitchen made it difficult to find anything.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, her cat's playful antics always led to slovenliness in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The slovenliness of the abandoned house was a stark reminder of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The slovenliness of the streets after the parade was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Careless or negligent in one's work or appearance.
meanings.sent1: His slovenliness in completing assignments often led to poor grades.
meanings.sent2: The employee's slovenliness in dressing appropriately for work was noticed by the supervisor.
meanings.sent3: Despite his slovenliness, he always managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The slovenliness of the painting job left streaks of color in unintended places.
meanings.sent5: Her slovenliness in following instructions resulted in a failed experiment.
